title: Extremely well designed, sturdy product that produces an excellent large shot!
body:
We received this on June 14th and throughout the day on June 14th my boyfriend was so enthralled with this item he managed to drink 5 espresso shots! This is an amazing product! It is easy to use. It comes with a small cleaning brush for dusting away any stray grounds. It actually produces what I would almost classify as a double shot. I worked in a coffee shop for 4 years and the amount of espresso it puts out is definitely more than a single shot. The shot it produced was perfect! The amount of froth was minimal but enough to produce a beautiful color on top.

The unit came in a nice sturdy protective case. It was just longer than the length of my hand so it will be perfect for using on the go, camping, backpacking, etc. Honestly, my boyfriend and I work 24 hour shifts in EMS and don't always have time to stop at a coffee shop between calls, or the coffee shop isn't open at 02:00am when we really need it. I think if we have this prepped and ready and can get to some hot water this will be a great help in staying alert and not feeling bloated from drinking 4 regular cups of coffee from our base stations coffee pot.

The one tip we both discussed: We buy whole bean espresso beans and have a small electric grinder at home. This unit seems to work best when the grounds are extremely fine. The first two shots were our experimental ones. We found that if we double ground the beans to create an extra fine product the shot came out so much cleaner. I would recommend getting as fine of a grind as possible before creating a shot.

All in all with getting the beans out of the cupboard, double grinding, boiling water, and producing the shot it took less than 5 minutes. This is such a frugal/economical way to have espresso throughout the day. We are seriously considering buying everyone in our families who enjoy espresso one of these for Christmas, as well as possibly buying one more to keep in one of our bags for work.

title: cette machine pourrait faire un bon café
body:
Si vous êtes prêt à jouer avec tout ce qui est impliqué dans le processus, - cette machine pourrait faire un bon café.
J'avoue que ma première impression était mauvaise (comme sur la première photo).
Alors j'ai pensé, que vous ne devriez pas mettre le café à la planche dans le porte-café (comme sur la deuxième photo). Oui, vous avez votre tasse à mesurer pour vous guider mais si le porte-café est trop plein, vous aurez un mauvais résultat.
J'ai aussi pensé que vous pourriez le visser un peu plus loin après que les premières gouttes de café sortiront de la machine. En fait, je pense qu’il est même préférable de faire une pose d’environ 5 à 15 secondes à ce moment-là, de laisser le café moudre préchauffé par la première boue de l’eau bouillante qui le traverse. C'est fondamentalement un élément "secret" de toutes les machines à expresso sérieuses =)
Vous pouvez jouer avec la mouture, vous pouvez jouer avec le type de café, etc. Vous êtes en contrôle.
De bons résultats sont possibles - je confirme ce fait.
Mais il y a quelques mais.
Tout d'abord, si vous lisez attentivement le manuel, presque tout ce qui est impliqué dans le jeu sera considéré / peut être interprété par le fabricant comme un acte violant la garantie.
Presque tout ce que vous voudrez essayer augmentera le pression à l'intérieur de la machine et comme il n'y a aucun moyen de voir quelle est la valeur réelle, il n'y aura aucun signe que ce que vous ferez finira par endommager la machine avant que ce déjà fait.
Si vous ajoutez à cela la mauvaise qualité des pièces qui augmentent la capacité de cette machine, le futur ne semble pas très brillant.
Ensuite, il faut prendre le temps de nettoyer la machine après chaque coup de café. Donc, si vous faites le café pour deux, il vaut mieux acheter un kit Barrista. Sinon, vous serez très frustré, tout comme moi =)
Quoi qu’il en soit, faire une bonne tasse de café avec cette machine est tout à fait possible.

La dernière chose à prendre en compte - la couleur réelle de la machine est GRIS, pas le noir comme, par exemple, la couleur de la tasse à mesurer (la dernière photo). Ce que j'essaie de dire - ce n’est pas idéal, et si vous envisagez d’obtenir la machine de couleur orange, mais vous avez encore des doutes quant à la praticité de la couleur - sans aucun doute, achetez la couleur orange.
J'espère que Wacaco fabriquera aussi le Barrista Kit de couleur orange.

title: Mega für unterwegs
body:
Wer Kaffee mag und viel und gerne unterwegs ist ist hiermit super aufgehoben. Empfehle aber das neuere Modell, welches noch kleiner ist. Kann dazu nicht viel sagen, aber denke es wird genauso gut sein wie dieses, nur noch kleiner.

Jetzt aber etwas ausführlicher:
Lasst mich mit einer kleinen Geschichte beginnen,
wir waren im Auto auf dem Weg nach Bayern, Urlaub, 1 Woche im schönen Garmisch-Partenkirchen. Dann allerdings standen wir im Stau. Vollsperrung, 2 Stunden nichts. Zum Glück hatten wir diese Kaffee Maschine dabei. Einfach dazu noch eine Thermoskanne mit heißem Wasser und schon ist es perfekt. Wir haben mittlerweile den NS-Adapter und uns verschiedenste Kapseln bestellt. Ohne Kapseln funktioniert es auch sehr gut, allerdings sind die Kapseln für unterwegs einfach ein Traum. Gibt sie in verschiedensten Kaffee Sorten, welche man früher noch gar nicht kannte. Nicht einfach nur basic Cappuccino oder Espresso oder sonst was. Wir haben mittlerweile Karamell Kaffee und welchen mit Schokolade, sowie als auch normalen Kakao. Alles funktioniert einfach super.

Ein negativpunkt ist dort aber, weswegen es dann doch nur 4 Sterne gibt. Dieser ist die Temperatur. Der Kaffee oder das Getränk ist natürlich warm (sofern man heißes Wasser dabei hat). Aber selbst das in den Klammern ist schon das Problem. Über lange Zeit immer heißes Wasser unterwegs zu haben ist gar nicht so leicht wie man denkt. Vielleicht gibt es ein paar Leute, welche unterwegs Outdoor sind und einen Kocher für heißes Wasser dabei haben. Dort sollte es kein Problem geben, sonst aber schon. Das viel größere Problem ist allerdings, das selbst bei sehr heißem Wasser der erste Kaffee meist dann nicht mehr so warm ist, da das Gerät natürlich selbst kalt ist am Anfang. Nach dem ersten Durchlauf ist das Problem dann zwar weg, aber wenn man schon nicht immer perfekt warmes Wasser hat und dann noch das Problem dazu kommt wird es echt blöd.
Deswegen 4 von 5 Sternen.

title: Coffee is great ... slow and hard work
body: The coffee produced by this device is great. When in the back of beyond, if you buy the barista kit too, you will get a crema on a great tasting espresso if you: a) use fresh beans (roasted between 7 and 21 days is perfect); b) pre-warm the machine; c) grind the beans just before use (beans degrade after about 5 minutes after grinding) d) and get the grind size just right (too fine and the effort is ridiculous - too course and you get nothing). When you get this just right, there will be subtle nuanced tastes to discover, and it's not far off a barista pulled shot from a £20,000 machine in a West End coffee house - especially appreciated when in the back of beyond. That's the positive side. Now to the negatives. The kit list you actually need to carry around is extensive. To make this work at the optimum level you need to carry a) a portable grinder; b) a litre+ bottle of water (2l is good for the day for 2 of you and don't forget you need water to warm the unit plus water for your coffee and water for washing up); c) a jet boil or other portable stove; d) a refrigerated flask of milk/cream according to taste; e) a tea towel for drying; f) the barista kit to get the dose size up to scratch. To make two coffees; allow up to an hour to an hour for full setup, drink, clean up and pack away. It's also surprisingly hard work to squeeze out the espresso - nigh on impossible if your grind is too fine. I can't see away around carrying all of this without accepting compromise on taste or drink format. Finally, it's all a bit messy and you wouldn't want to do it at your desk in the office (grinds and drips of coffee end up everywhere); and you really want a kitchen sink handy to wash/dry everything afterwards. I had a lot of fun in experimenting to get this right. I'd hoped for a desktop solution to mediocre coffee in the office. I am not sure this works due to the cleaning and maintenance. The barista kit should come with a case for the resized machine in my opinion. This is probably going to end up at the back of the cupboard.

title: Great espresso on the go
body:
I love this product, it allows me to have a great espresso where i wouldn't be able to get one. work, hotel room, walking and everything in between.

The positives:
easy to use once you are used to it.
makes great espresso, pod or ground.
compact.
hardy.
nice features like cups and 'add on' kits

the negatives:
you can over tighten pods and this can lead to coffee break through.
you can use to fine a ground tamped to tightly, this can also lead to coffee break through
if possible you should preheat cup and water chamber to have a piping hot coffee
the barista kit can take quite a toll on the pump (twice the coffee and twice the liquid)
the pump has started to let a little air leak past
the full clean can be annoying (but if you dont cause coffee break through this isnt an issue)

there seems a lot of negatives but once you have a technique down then most of these are a moot point.

it makes a great cup of coffee and there is nothing i would use instead to get my cup of espresso. infact i have become somewhat of a coffee snob and even find coffee shop espressos lacking these days.
really recommend it!

title: Fantastic. I just got the nanopresso three days ago ...
body:
Fantastic. I just got the nanopresso three days ago and made around 6 espressos. As with any device that involves pressure buildup and seals, the real verdict will have to include durability. But for now I have to say that I am seriously impressed with the quality of espresso it makes, including the crema (and these are just my first trials, I still need to optimize the grind size and amount). The first thing one notices during unpacking is the really high quality of the materials and finish. Operation is really simple. Most importantly, cleanup seems to be really easy. It is straightforward to eject the grind-puck from the holder, and the rest is just rinsing. I will take it on my upcoming trip. However, unlike one of the other reviewers, who used it on a plane, I will not put it in my hand luggage, let alone start pumping on a device that looks a little like a grenade in mid-flight. I do not want to be put on the no-fly list :-)

UPDATE: After about 2 months (maybe around 100 shots made), a plastic part in the nozzle broke (see photo), which did not directly affect performance. However, a few days later, the pump unit failed and there is no longer pressure buildup. I did not do anything out of the ordinary during operation at that time.

body:

Ich hab zum Glück die Pico ebenso getestet und dort kommt echter Espresso wie aus meiner Siebträger, hier ist die Brüheinheit wie bei einer siebträger. title: LOVE this product after 2.5 years!
body:
I hardly ever write reviews but feel that this product needs one. We purchased this in July 2018 and use it EVERY SINGLE DAY to make 2-4 mugs of (Americano) coffee. It makes the best espresso (it even has the crema on top!) for such a simple unit. We've taken it camping, backpacking, to friends' houses (who don't drink coffee), etc. With this we bought the Baristo Kit so we make a double shot of espresso and top it off with hot water. The unit is easy to clean and easy to operate (& builds muscle as it gives you a little bit of a workout!). I held off on reviewing this for some time because about a year ago I contacted the company to get a replacement gasket (the larger orange one) to have as a back-up in case the one that came with it failed. At that time they said that they did not sell this gasket separately. I was not happy as without this gasket, this product would not work (it would not be able to build up the pressure necessary), and this gasket is custom to this product so it would be probably impossible to find it elsewhere. Well, sure enough about 3 months ago, the gasket got a little horizontal split in it. It still worked but coffee grounds would get underneath it and you had to take the gasket off after each shot to clean it. Because we were taking it on/off repeatedly I didn't think the gasket would last too much longer. So I contacted the company again, though their website and lo and behold, they were now selling this gasket for $1 each. I ordered 2 of them (just in case!) and the shipping was $7. But it was coming from China so it took about 6 weeks to get here. However, it was worth the wait because it works just as it did when it was new, no having to clean under the gasket each time we make a shot of espresso. We are very, very happy with this little device and have put away or set aside our regular coffee makers & Keurig. One last comment... occasionally, the device for some reason does not build up pressure when pumping it (the pump handle just goes in & out without resistance). Not sure why this happens as it happens so infrequently and we haven't figured out a pattern. When this has happened (maybe 5 times in 2.5 years) I just unscrew all of the pieces, pump out any excess water from the main unit and repack the ground coffee in the pod. Doing all that has always fixed it in the past. But as I mentioned, this has rarely happened. Also, if the pump is REALLY hard to press, then either the coffee is ground too fine &/or you have packed it too tightly in the pod.
If you decide to buy this little bit of heaven...Enjoy! ;-)
UPDATE (4/27/21):
Alas, it did finally die not long after I wrote the above review. I think a spring-loaded connector came loose and without a way to open the device, there was no way to see the problem, let alone fix it. However, we have loved it so much we bought another one when it was on sale at Costco.com. The first replacement we bought squeaked loudly with each press (totally unacceptable) so we returned that one and purchased another which seems to be working fine. It came with the Nespresso adapter which was a nice added feature as the espresso roast Nespresso pods make very good coffee. However, we still use the Barista double shot kit daily and our own ground coffee so it was still worth it to us to purchase another one of these. I guess when you look at it buying this vs. visiting Starbuck's 16 times for a $5 coffee (which both cost about the same price!), we definitely would choose this!

title: Angelic Ambrosia, dont give up, worth the learning curve.
body: This can be as simple as learning a single shot of espresso or as complicated as buying the addon barrista set. My story: first shot was gross and super sour. Literally pigswill. Why? Had expensive fresh beans from a diect trade farm. Answer: I gound it in a regular spice grinder. Took the exact same beans, had them gound in a local coffee shop grinder to espresso grind, came home made the exact same shot - it was so good I declared I now knew what it was like to visit Italy. It was HEAVENLY. No exaggeration. So dont by beans unless you gave a great grinder. Just buy ground espresso. Next, came getting a system together. The Aevo milk frother/steamer is expensive, fast and worth every cent. I put pics in order of operation. Fill cup with hot water to warm while setting up. Fill nanopresso with hot water from kettle and push just water through to heat mechanism. Add oat milk or milk to Aevo frother. Weigh 8grams of coffee and tamp down tight and then coffee to machine and re-add boiling kettle water for actual shot. Hit button on Aveo to start it working while you do espresso shot. Dump out hot water warming your cup and start pumping espresso shot into warmed cup. By the time your finished frother will be completed. At thus point you can pour in your milk and enjoy. I usually clean the nanopresso after shot pour and before oat milk addition. Tips: too much coffee makes to strong and almost impossible to pump. Too much water makes it weak, and the wrong grind makes it sour. This is easily a 8-10 minute high intensify, physical and mental process, but the end result is literally better than most espresso I've bough in coffee shops. Honestly, better than everyone of them. Also I don't use milk I use Oatly Barrista oatmilk which has a high fat content. Regular oat milk from the store is gross, its too watery. Also, if this seems way to hard to bother with or too scary, dont be put of by the seemly endless steps. Its like driving. Soon you wonder why you were concerned. You're a great driver and you'll be a great espresso shot maker. It becomes autopilot once its in your muscle memory. The chart I include was from the barrista set which I don't bother using but I posted for reference. This set alone is enough for me. I've only had the nanopresso for six days but I'm telling you if I had to live without it I'd be concerned for my future happiness lol - but no seriously...incase I haven't made it clear I love this thing. Its easily with 100 dollars. I'd pay 500 after getting hooked on it. Its just such quality you never expect to have at home without a 10k+ machine. Your vistors will thank you. Also my triceps are freaking on point from the manual pumping. This is top-notch espresso extraction. My only con for this prduct is the heat. Its hotter in a cafe, but I'll work on that... also the cup in the picture is Japanese pattern produced from 1969 to 1988. Bought cup in a second hand shop, but can be found on eBay.. Cheers, friends! And best wishes with your coffee dreams.

title: If you have a newborn that won't sleep, this is for you.
body:
I was hesitant to plunk down $60+ for what I thought to be a luxury item, but man was this worth it. My wife and I just welcomed our second child, and this thing arrived in the nick of time. I love espresso and had been making a reasonably decent version in my French press, but this is whole new level of quality and convenience. When I take into account how much time this thing saves me and how much money I'm saving not purchasing espresso one shot at a time in coffee shops, this thing has already paid for itself in a month and a half of use.

BUILD: It's very durable; nothing seems flimsy or breakable. It's extremely easy to clean; often the coffee comes cleanly out of the filter like a hockey puck. I start my morning with this and considering you're only boiling a few ounces of water, you go from nothing to a finished shot (with every part cleaned and set back on a drying rack) in less than a minute. No exaggeration.

THE PROCESS: You may be turned off by the fact that this is manual, but I think it's nothing but a plus. You only need boiling water. It takes no time to pump out a single shot. However, if you suffer from arthritis or some sort of physical issue involving your hands, this probably would NOT be for you. I think that any annoyance that may come from manual pumping is balanced out by the fact that this thing is so portable.

TASTE: Thanks to several years of wine tastings and working in fine dining, I can say that my taste buds are pretty refined. Trust me: with a high quality bean and the right grind, this thing produces some stellar espresso. You'll not want to order from a coffee shop after you dial in what's right for you. I found that just touch above extra fine ground gives you a pour that has a very bold, deep complexity with a slight sweetness.

FINALLY: This things is well worth the money. Once you get the hang of the steps you can do this half asleep (trust me, I do each morning). Consider the money you're not spending at coffee shops and it's a great value. Le réservoir d'origine est vraiment trop petit car la quantité de café au final est inférieure à celle de l'eau mise dans le réservoir. Ce qui est normal puisque l'eau passe à travers du café et que celui-ci conserve une partie de l'eau. On obtient donc un tout petit café...
Pour pallier à cet inconvénient j'ai acheté l'option Wacaco Nanovessel, ballon isotherme 3 en 1 . La quantité d'eau qu'il contient permet de faire des cafés plus ou moins longs. Il permet aussi d'emporter et de conserver l'eau chaude et de pouvoir faire plusieurs cafés. Il peut aussi servir à faire un thé ou une infusion.
En conclusion je pense qu'un réservoir d'origine un peu plus grand serait le bienvenu car l'option Wacaco Nanovessel, ballon isotherme 3 en 1 vaut quand même 30€ ...

Ich habe ein Neugerät erhalten, ausgepackt, ausprobiert und voila, das Teil lässt sogar meine Bialetti Brikka bezüglich Crema im Schatten stehen!! Bin begeistert.
Meine Empfehlung für einen guten Espresso:
1.) Frische Espresso-Röstung kaufen (aus dem Kontaktröster)
2.) Sofort in der Rösterei auf Stufe 2 (Einstellung für Espresso Kocher) mahlen lassen
3.) Den Kaffeepulverbehälter befüllen, nicht ganz so voll machen und nicht verpressen!! Nur leicht seitlich klopfen, damit sich das Pulver gut verteilt.
4.) Tasse mit heissem Wasser aufwärmen (da ich es im Büro nutze, habe ich eine Porzellan Tasse), dann wie in der Anleitung vorgehen und mit einigen Pumphüben den Espresso in die Tasse geben. Bitte nach jedem Hub ca. 2 Sekunden gedrückt halten bis Nachlauf fertig ist und dann den nächsten Hub machen. Mit Ruhe gemachter Espresso entfaltet noch besseres Aroma.

Mit dieser Vorgehensweise hab ich rund 3 mm hohe Crema, vollstes Aroma erzielt. Bin gespannt wie lange das Gerät hält. Es macht einen stabilen Eindruck.

1. Bestellung:
OffTopic... Das Gerät konnte ich nicht einmal ausprobieren, da beim auspacken schon leicht braunes Wasser mir entgegen kam. Gewisse Spuren an der Verpackung machten mich schon am Anfang stutzig. Ein gebrauchtes Gerät!!!, was vielleicht schon von anderen Kunden zurück gesandt wurde. Das ist völlig inakzeptabel!!! Rücksendung umwendend. ich überlege mir es noch einmal zu bestellen und hoffe dass ich dann Neuware erhalte Und auch entsprechend gute Rezensionen geben kann.

title: Excelente!
body:
Play Video
Desde que supe que salió la minipresso de wakako quise tenerla. Gracias a Dios, por circunstancias ajenas a mí no me la pude comprar, porque al poco tiempo salió la nanopresso. Cuando la compré la verdad quedé fascinado y hasta la fecha me sigue fascinando.

Es una excelente máquina de espresso portátil. El único detalle que tiene es que necesitas aprender a moler el café de manera correcta, porque de lo contrario si lo mueles demasiado fino el café no va a salir por el orificio donde debes y sino que va a salir también por los lados. Pero eso también incluso tiene una solución.

Es un excelente producto altamente recomendado magnífico es una obra maestra ideal para quién quiere hacerse un expreso.

Ahora lo único que me falta es adquirir el estuche para el nano preso cuando tiene el la extensión del barista kit y el vessel.

Lo recomiendo ampliamente es un excelente producto sin ningún desperdicio.

Vale cada peso que cuesta

title: Works great for camping!
body: We took the Nanopresso Portable Espresso Maker, along with the nespresso adapter, camping this weekend. I was a little nervous about investing that much into a portable espresso maker, but the Nanopresso worked great and was easy to use! Once we removed it from the box and into the case, it fit easily into backpacks and kitchen bins without taking up a lot of space. The Nanopresso did not fit into the case with the nespresso adapter still attached, but it wasn't a hassle to simply switch out the top and store the adapter separately.
author: Stephanie Moravec
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 25 de julio de 2019

title: I craft my coffee with this every morning
body:
Love my Nanopresso. Very solid and well built. Perfect size to make a perfect cup of Latte. 7 pumps to build pressure and another 20 pumps my expresso is ready!! I find that the best way is to grind the beans fresh. There is some magic in using this pump to make your own cup of joe. I tell my wife that I don't just take a cup of coffee and pour it down my throat anymore. I craft my latte and drink it slowly to appreciate it.

I plan to travel and go camping with it. It will fit nicely in my backpack.

title: Nice little coffee maker
body:
Nice little coffee maker. Important to make sure your water is VERY hot, and that you "rinse" all parts with that same very hot water right before using it, or you'll end up with a relatively cold espresso. It's very compact, and does't require too much effort to get the espresso made.

I also ordered the Nespresso capsule NS Adapter directly from the manufacturer when it got released 10 days ago. Pity it's not sold together, as I prefer using Nespresso capsules rather than having ground coffee with you.

The case that it comes in is a nice touch!!! I really like this unit.
